It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs with dense, compact growth habits. The plants are characterized by their small, often evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink, white, and purple. Scyphostegia species are typically found in rocky or mountainous regions, where they thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to form dense ground cover in challenging environments.
